hypothesis_content.title: DOGE/PEPE Meme Coin Fade on Extreme Social Sentiment Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: When a meme coin (DOGE or PEPE) experiences a >150% spike in its social volume/mention rate (vs 7-day average) concurrent with a price gain of >15% in 24 hours, a short position entered at the next hourly close will be profitable within the next 12 hours in a NEUTRAL or BEAR regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Meme coins are highly driven by retail sentiment and social hype. An extreme, concurrent spike in both price and social chatter in non-bull regimes often represents a short-term sentiment climax or 'pump', which is frequently followed by a rapid fade as early buyers take profits and hype dissipates.
entry_conditions: Social volume/mention rate > 250% of its 7-day average (per alternative data source)
Enter short at the close of the 1-hour candle confirming the above conditions

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes a new 24-hour high after entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The hypothesis fails if the short trade has a win rate below 50% or if the average return after such a sentiment spike remains positive over the 12-hour window, indicating sustained momentum instead of a fade.
